meanings.definition: Able to be ignored or disregarded.
meanings.sent1: The background noise was ignorable during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The small typo in the email was easily ignorable.
meanings.sent3: The ignorable fly buzzing around the room provided some unintentional entertainment.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an ignorable flicker of light in a dark room.
meanings.sent5: The ignorable smell of fresh cookies made her mouth water.

meanings.definition: Capable of being overlooked or dismissed.
meanings.sent1: The scratch on the table was ignorable and didn't bother anyone.
meanings.sent2: His rude comment was not easily ignorable and caused tension in the room.
meanings.sent3: The ignorable delay in the train schedule made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The old photo was an ignorable reminder of days gone by.
meanings.sent5: The ignorable crack in the wall grew bigger over time.
